page.title: 09DEEPDALES FARM,NR.LEASINGHAM
page.content: At{Deepdales Farm near Leasingham,}the farmer,Mr.Kyme, has about{500 acres}of land on which he grows,sugar beet, potatoes,cereal and grass.He told me,to be a good farmer you need to be very interested in{farming,}and be prepared to work in all sorts of weathers.He employs{5}workmen,who do all sorts of jobs that need doing.The most difficult and busiest season,he thinks,is from August to December, because of{harvesting. The farmer also keeps cows,in fact he has about{Â£25,000}worth of them.He uses lots of chemical fertilisers and applies them with a sprayer,drawn by a tractor.The chemicals cost around{Â£160 per tonne.To protect him,the driver of the sprayer is given gloves and mask and protective clothing.Before spraying,he must check the wind direction.
